intro: Ozothamnus retusus, commonly known as the rigid thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in compact clusters, typically blooming from late winter to early spring. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Ozothamnus retusus is used in some regions for erosion control due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
